item.title: Interest rates will fall again when inflation returns to target but that could require a painful adjustment
item.description: And until someone — redundant workers, big business, the RBA or government — foots the bill, interest rates are unlikely to budge from here.

item.title: Usman Khawaja has seen politicians 'all over cricket', now he's joining other athletes to get action
item.description: Cricketer Usman Khawaja is one of the highest-profile Australian athletes who regularly wades into political issues. Now, Khawaja and other athletes have agreed to form a Players' Coalition to influence policy change on issues ranging from racism and human rights to social media abuse.

item.title: Trans people push to make healthcare more inclusive in the regions
item.description: A Queensland trans man says healthcare workers did not fully understand his needs when he sought fertility treatment.

item.title: Is the AI bubble too big to burst?
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: How the Lions conquered their growing pains to reach AFLW top four
item.description: After a shaky start to the season the Brisbane Lions showed faith in a shift in game style to climb up the ladder and guarantee themselves a top-four finish.

item.title: Suzanne Rees died alone on Lizard Island. How did it happen?
item.description: Suzanne Rees joined a hike on Queensland's Lizard Island as part of a cruise stopover. She would never make it back to the boat.

item.title: Emergency doctors say RAH admitted more patients than bed limit, SA Health denies claim
item.description: The Australasian College of Emergency Medicine says on a day in September there were 70 admitted inpatients in the Royal Adelaide Hospital's emergency department that has 68 beds — a claim disputed by SA Health.

item.title: Many migrant woman facing having to 'start from scratch' in Australia but an employment program is trying to help
item.description: Migrant and refugee women often struggle to find employment upon arriving in Australia, even if they have experience and qualifications. A 14-week program is trying to help.

item.title: Skills program helps migrant women find pathways to work
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Holiday workers propping up key sectors exposed to serious workplace injuries
item.description: Many young people on the Working and Holiday Visa programs come to Australia to fill labour shortages in industries like meat processing and farming, but there are concerns around their health and safety in dangerous workplaces.

item.title: Carnarvon heritage attractions left in disrepair while tourist numbers fall
item.description: Residents of a historic WA town are frustrated that their heritage icons are being left in disrepair.

item.title: Who made the 2025 Booker Prize shortlist, who missed out and who will win
item.description: 'Spiky characters' and 'luminous writing': Here's what we thought of the prestigious literary award's 2025 shortlist, the first with Sarah Jessica Parker as judge.

item.title: Pen pals enjoy 60-year friendship from opposite sides of the world
item.description: Sixty years ago in Canada, 12-year-old Diane Hatt went searching for a pen pal in Australia. She found one in South Australian Joy Doevendans and they've become best friends.

item.title: Quick and easy tomato and halloumi bake for busy weeknights - ABC News
item.description: This tomato and halloumi bake requires only a handful of ingredients, sliced and seasoned and popped in a baking dish.

item.title: She accused him of rape, but Prince Andrew's downfall is too late for Virginia Roberts Giuffre
item.description: In many ways, justice has been robbed from Epstein survivor Virginia Roberts Giuffre. Prince Andrew's stripped titles are a posthumous victory.

item.title: Nhulunbuy Tennis Club faces final serve as Rio Tinto mine closure looms
item.description: The impending departure of Rio Tinto raises concerns about the future of sporting clubs in Nhulunbuy. But there are hopes increased investment in regional sports can help sustain the community's active lifestyle.

item.title: Tanzania election protests leave hundreds dead, main opposition party says
item.description: President Samia Suluhu Hassan this week held an election in which her main challengers were either jailed or barred from standing.

item.title: Buy Australian campaign aims to save dwindling domestic food manufacturing industry
item.description: Experts warn that Australian food manufacturing is under threat as shoppers turn to cheaper imported items, but the federal government is trying to promote locally grown produce.

item.title: Fathers and daughters, international rowing champions and wartime love feature in our top WA October photos
item.description: Our photographers this month illustrate a significant day for WA's history, a woman's struggle with her tiny home and a group of rowers competing on the world stage.

item.title: Liam Gallagher incensed by flare let off at Melbourne Oasis concert
item.description: A flare let off by a crowd member at the first of three Melbourne Oasis concerts has angered the band's co-founder Liam Gallagher, sparking an expletive-laden post.

item.title: Warren Tredrea was the Power's premiership captain, but has now been booted from its board
item.description: The Port Adelaide Football Club continues to describe Warren Tredrea as one of its greatest-ever players — but on Friday it dismissed him from its board of directors.

item.title: Japan wants to hire more bear hunters after record number of people attacked
item.description: In the past six months, there have been four times the number of people killed by bears compared with last year, and the Japanese government wants to hire hunters to help cull the animals.

item.title: Monkey escape in Mississippi gives a glimpse into the secretive world of animal research
item.description: A truck carrying 21 research monkeys overturned in Mississippi, spilling wooden crates labelled "live monkeys" into the tall grass near the highway.

item.title: Australia criticises 'lost opportunity' for strengthened Antarctic conservation
item.description: The Australian government says it's "disappointed" after an international conservation meeting in Hobart failed to reach agreement on improved protection measures in Antarctica.

item.title: NSW mental health nurse disqualified after intimate relationship with patient
item.description: The NSW Civil and Administrative Tribunal has found a mental health nurse guilty of professional misconduct after she was observed hugging and kissing a patient.

item.title: Eagles to make historic AFLW finals appearance after Swans fall to Bombers
item.description: Daisy Pearce's West Coast Eagles have reached the AFLW finals for the first time after the Sydney Swans blew their chance in a shock three-point loss to struggling Essendon at Coffs Harbour.

item.title: Police charge teen after officers allegedly assaulted at Byford Halloween party
item.description: Two police officers were allegedly assaulted while shutting down an out-of-control Halloween party attended by hundreds of people in Perth's southern suburbs.

item.title: Melbourne Cup 2025 field, horses, form guide and betting
item.description: A steady stream of money sees the Irish raider Al Riffa firm into favouritism, as the track begins to dry out after solid rain on Monday. Explore our interactive form guide to all the horses set to line up in the great race.

item.title: Tanzanian president Samia Suluhu Hassan wins disputed election with more than 97pc of vote, results show
item.description: The result is likely to amplify the concerns of critics, opposition groups and others who said the election was not a contest but a coronation, after the president's two main rivals were barred or prevented from running.

item.title: Three players sin-binned as Australia win torrid second Test 14-4 over England to retain Ashes
item.description: Australia have won a tough physical battle in Liverpool to claim the second Test against England and ensure they will retain the Ashes.

item.title: England power past Wallabies 25-7 at Twickenham as Matt Dawson slams Australians as being 'woeful'
item.description: The Wallabies are overpowered by a disciplined and ruthless England team, which wins its eighth-straight international to claim victory at Twickenham.

item.title: Two more people charged over Louvre heist in Paris
item.description: The man and woman deny any involvement in the heist as investigations continue.

item.title: Share your experience with the housing market
item.description: What's your experience looking to buy your first home, or find an affordable, stable rental? We want to hear from you.

item.title: Prince Andrew is leaving Windsor Estate. Why wasn't he given another property on the grounds?
item.description: Andrew Mountbatten Windsor's eviction from his mansion in Windsor Castle is the latest part of a reshuffle of royals around the estate's grounds. Here's where everyone lives.

item.title: Australians are being priced out of the property market and first home buyers schemes might not be helping
item.description: A recent auction for a three-bedroom townhouse in Brisbane has captured just how much property prices have skyrocketed in recent years, highlighting the nation’s fast-growing housing affordability crisis.

item.title: When is the RBA meeting next? When will interest rates go down?
item.description: Many people paying off mortgages were hoping for a cash rate cut, but recent inflation data means that is highly unlikely.

item.title: Labor takes fight to Greens in key seats over environment laws
item.description: As it negotiates with the Greens and the Coalition over its proposed overhaul of environment laws, Labor is preparing a campaign accusing the minor party of obstructing its agenda.

item.title: Talking about aged care in multicultural families can be hard but these tips may help
item.description: Discussing aged care in culturally diverse families can be a sensitive subject. Here's how some approached the conversation.

item.title: Horse racing replays edited to remove falls and deaths as industry grapples with social licence
item.description: For years, the racing industry has been quietly removing falls and deaths from its replays. Now, industry insiders are speaking out.

item.title: A game for the ages: Nan and teen granddaughter line up together in country netball
item.description: A grandmother and granddaughter played for their regional Victorian netball team, turning a secret plan into a moment of country sport history.

item.title: Copper theft costing Queensland taxpayers millions of dollars every year, as rate of crime increases
item.description: Experts say cost of living pressures, and the ability to make money quickly, is behind a surge in copper thefts which are leaving highways and sporting fields in the dark.

item.title: Do the Queensland government’s claims about the surgical waiting list stack up?
item.description: Queensland's government declared victory on elective surgery wait times but thousands of patients are waiting longer than recommended — and specialists warn the fix is short-term at best.

item.title: From death masks to selfies: The history of our love-affair with portraits
item.description: Whether it's an ancient death mask found on an Egyptian sarcophagus or the selfie you have just cropped on your phone, we have been creating portraits for centuries. So why do we love them so much?

item.title: How taxidermists are 'honouring the life' of extraordinary creatures through art and science
item.description: From a taxidermied mynah bird perched on a teacup to a mammoth leatherback turtle, here are the "extraordinary creatures" these taxidermists are preserving.

item.title: House prices have been climbing for a generation. Undoing the damage could take even longer
item.description: It's an inconvenient truth that a housing crisis that took a generation to create cannot be fixed easily. The damage will likely take another generation to undo, unless the solution comes at the expense of those who already own their homes.

item.title: Australian number one Maya Joint loses in Hong Kong Open semis, Kim Birrell through to Chennai final
item.description: Australian number one Maya Joint falls short of reaching the Hong Kong Open final, but compatriot Kimberly Birrell wins through to the tournament decider in Chennai.

item.title: Think you've got what it takes to top this quiz? It's time to play ... HARD!
item.description: Let's get it straight: you'll probably do badly on this quiz, and I'll judge you. It's time to play … HARD!

item.title: Pitch invader stands with Kangaroos during national anthems before Ashes Test against England
item.description: A man is arrested by police after he lined up next to Cameron Munster before the Kangaroos' victory over England in the second Ashes Test in England.

item.title: Rock climbers' defiance grows over Mount Arapiles cultural site requests
item.description: Rock climbers are publicly urging others to ignore Parks Victoria's requests to avoid culturally significant routes at Mount Arapiles Dyurrite in western Victoria.

item.title: Kirsha Kaechele banned men from MONA's Ladies Lounge — and won
item.description: No men are allowed at Kirsha Kaechele's Ladies Lounge and the Supreme Court agrees. The artist, curator and "missus" of MONA's owner knows how to cross boundaries, but can she solve Tasmania's thorniest dispute?

item.title: South-east Queensland struck by second night of storms as residents assess hail damage
item.description: Queensland residents still counting the cost of giant hailstones that fell on Saturday afternoon were struck by a second round of storms on Sunday, with hailstones up to eight centimetres in diameter reported at Googa Creek.

item.title: Sting linked to AN0M encrypted app which brought down criminals around the world enters new phase
item.description: An international covert sting linked to the encrypted AN0M platform which brought down hundreds of alleged criminals and netted cash, drugs and weapons has reached a new phase.

item.title: Women's crisis shelter waits years to sub-lease vacant NT building
item.description: An Aboriginal-led domestic violence support service is demanding answers over stalled progress in establishing a women's shelter in remote Northern Territory.

item.title: Qld police say workers compensation scheme adds to psychological distress
item.description: Labelled "combative" and "demeaning" by some Queensland police and academics, the WorkCover claims process leaves a former officer questioning her self-worth.

item.title: Jockey Ethan Brown makes rise from from near-fatal fall to Melbourne Cup
item.description: Two years after a near-fatal fall, 25-year-old Alice Springs-born jockey has had a bumper season with 32 wins. Now he is riding in the Melbourne Cup.

item.title: Calls for road map for disability employment providers after Bedford's troubles
item.description: Some in the disability employment sector say they are operating in an increasingly complex and changing environment, and that there is a need for a clear way forward for organisations supporting people with complex needs.

item.title: Coalition won't back environment reforms without changes
item.description: The Coalition says it cannot support major reforms to Australia's environment laws in their current reform, setting a bar as they enter deep negotiations with the federal government.

item.title: Christmas Island shrew declared extinct after decades without a sighting
item.description: A researcher says the long-suspected extinction of the mouse-sized mammal is "another stain" on Australia's environmental record.

item.title: Did a former Perth bikie order the public assassination of his one-time gang leader?
item.description: With all the hallmarks of a Hollywood blockbuster, the high-profile murder trial of ex-bikie David Pye in WA's Supreme Court was never going to be a pedestrian affair.

item.title: Southern NSW summer rice and cotton crops shrink amid water shortages
item.description: Southern NSW rice and cotton growers are heading into one of their smallest summer cropping seasons in years, with tight water allocations forcing many to halve their plantings or sit the season out altogether.

item.title: Spotlight on youth justice after dozens arrested in WA's north
item.description: The political spotlight has once again turned to preventing and managing youth crime in Western Australia, but decision-makers are split on how best to tackle the issue.

item.title: Veteran credits his local RSL with helping to pull him out of darkness
item.description: A veteran in Victoria says he found hope and solace in his local RSL that "had his back" when he felt overwhelmed by his wife's early onset dementia.

item.title: High demand for ambulances in Melbourne and Geelong as weather warms up on Cup weekend
item.description: Victorians are being urged to only call triple-0 for critical cases as demand for an ambulance soars on the quasi-Melbourne Cup long weekend.

item.description: There are signs a critically endangered plant that grows on a rural property near Armidale could have a prosperous future.

item.title: The tensions inherent in Australia's housing crisis laid bare at Perth gallery
item.description: In an exhibition exploring the fraught issue of finding a home, artist Alana Hunt is directly inviting owners of multiple properties to solve her own, personal housing crisis.

item.title: Drones spot hidden koala population in NSW Snowy Mountains
item.description: A hidden group of koalas is found for the first time in a remote area of the New South Wales Snowy Mountains.

item.title: Nationals formally abandon commitment to reach net zero emissions by 2050
item.description: The Nationals have formally abandoned a commitment to reach net zero emissions by 2050, setting a challenge for Opposition leader Sussan Ley whether to follow or risk splitting the Coalition.

item.description: Jockey Jamie Melham says she will be doing a "rain dance" on Monday, ahead of riding Melbourne Cup favourite Half Yours.

item.description: A man charged with the domestic violence murder of 39-year-old Hunter woman Rhukaya Lake is remanded in custody.

item.title: AFLW round 12: Crows hold on to eliminate Dockers from finals contention, Lions finish third after beating Magpies
item.description: Adelaide has hung on for a thrilling 12-point win over Fremantle that secures its AFLW finals spot and ends the Dockers' season.

item.title: Easy low-alcohol cocktails and non-alcoholic drinks for summer
item.description: Having a range of drinks on offer can help everyone feel included, especially at end-of-year gatherings.

item.title: Eliesa Katoa fitted with oxygen mask during Tonga vs New Zealand Test match, Jillaroos defeat Kiwi Ferns
item.description: Tongan forward Eliesa Katoa has been fitted with an oxygen mask during the Pacific Championship Test match against New Zealand, after copping multiple blows to the head.

item.title: Inmate taken to hospital after alleged assault at SA's Yatala Labour Prison
item.description: A prisoner was taken to the hospital after the second alleged violent assault in two weeks in the South Australian prison system.

item.title: Australia's scandal-ridden childcare sector is a legacy of the 'golden age' of reform
item.description: The decision by past governments to push Australia's childcare industry in the direction of marketisation and corporatisation has left a lasting legacy.

item.title: India levels T20 series against Australia with impressive run chase in Hobart
item.description: India levels the Twenty20 series against Australia, sharing the blows with the bat for a five wicket win with nine balls to spare in Hobart.

item.description: All-round performances from Deepti Sharma and Shafali Verma have led India to a breakthrough World Cup triumph against South Africa in Navi Mumbai.

item.description: Dozens of wedding guests rushed to shelter children under tables and hold up the walls of a reception hall during an intense storm in Queensland's Banana Shire over the weekend.

item.description: Australia's property market is seeing rising demand, with record auctions over spring and a rise in both first home buyers and investors pushing up house prices.

item.title: Calls for football clubs to divest from pokies with more than $110 million lost to machines
item.description: There are calls for football teams to distance themselves from poker machines after data found more than $110 million was lost at venues owned by football clubs and leagues in the last financial year.

item.title: Australia supplying China with critical mineral vital for hypersonic missiles and its nuclear program
item.description: Australia is supplying raw materials vital for China's military build-up, while at the same time signing up to be a partner of choice for the United States as it seeks to break Beijing's critical minerals stranglehold.

item.title: House prices are accelerating again and the housing crisis is back on
item.description: The nation has not yet embraced the idea that housing needs to be more affordable, or that it's the most important economic and social issue facing the country.

item.title: Prepaid electricity consumers sweltering under regular disconnections, report finds
item.description: Communities on prepaid power meters face regular disconnections amid 40 degree-plus heat, meaning no aircon, food rotting in the fridge and long, hot walks to get reconnected.

item.title: The Nationals dumping net zero is dangerous territory for the Coalition
item.description: To borrow the words of former prime minister Tony Abbott, the net zero emissions by 2050 policy for the Coalition is now dead, buried and cremated.

item.title: From England to Flemington — 20 years on from Makybe Diva's third Melbourne Cup victory
item.description: From quiet beginnings, an unknown English filly came Down Under and changed Australia's racing history by achieving the impossible. This is how Makybe Diva won a historic third Melbourne Cup 20 years ago.

item.title: Weightlifting empowers women of all ages to stop feeling 'invisible'
item.description: Teenager Mira Mohan, and Francee and Carolyn, both in their 60s, are changing the face of weightlifting, showing it is a sport for women at any stage of life.

item.description: The death of a Brisbane man after a storm shone a spotlight on the dangers of overhead powerlines in a storm-prone state.

item.title: ACT voluntary assisted dying scheme begins, allowing Canberrans to 'die with dignity'
item.description: From today Canberrans like Gail Ford will be able to apply for the ACT's new voluntary assisted dying scheme, which its advocates say gives dignity in death to applicants.

item.title: Granite Island's little penguin population climbs despite SA's algal bloom
item.description: The small, fragile colony of surviving little penguins on South Australia's Granite Island records a "significant increase" in numbers amid the state's harmful algal bloom.

item.title: Former Prince Andrew set to be stripped of military rank by UK government
item.description: Andrew Mountbatten Windsor will be stripped of his last remaining military position as part of King Charles's decision to remove him from public life, according to the UK defence minister.

item.title: Legal Services Board of Victoria warns lawyers about AI in court
item.description: The use of artificial intelligence to prepare court documents raises questions in the legal profession about its use and misuse in the industry.

item.title: South-east Queensland lashed by two days of giant hail, with the possibility of more storms to come
item.description: Hundreds of residents remain without power after Saturday's wild storms, while others are tallying the cost of giant hail to their properties, cars and homes.

item.description: More wet weather is expected in south-east Queensland before clear skies return later this week.

item.title: Treasurer Rita Saffioti defends $1 million advertising blitz, as WA GST deal fight ramps up
item.description: The state government defends spending $1 million on an advertising campaign about Western Australia's GST deal, as the fight to protect the state's carve-up of the distribution ramps up.

item.title: Funding health is one of the biggest challenges facing Tasmania, as Eric Abetz prepares to hand down his first budget
item.description: A peak health body is worried Tasmania's public health system won't receive enough support in Thursday's state budget to address ballooning demand.

item.title: How hitchhiking 'suckerfish' reveal humpback whales' 'web of life'
item.description: Suckerfish, the ocean's ultimate hitchhikers, cling to humpback whales for thousands of kilometres and reveal surprising insights into life on the whale highway.

item.description: An 11-year-old boy has died in a quad bike crash that also injured a 38-year-old man at a mango farm south of Darwin.

item.description: Gold Coast tennis star Kimberly Birrell loses in the Chennai Open final but claims a sportsmanship award for touching moment.

item.description: Matildas Sam Kerr and Ellie Carpenter both score for Chelsea in an impressive performance from the Australian stars.

item.description: Women who have had traumatic birth experiences at Royal Darwin Hospital have gathered to share their stories and call for urgent action from the territory and federal governments.

item.title: Magnitude-6.3 earthquake hits Afghanistan
item.description: It is unclear how many people have died following an earthquake in northern Afghanistan, two months after a tremor killed more than 2,200 people.

item.title: Rescues on Bluff Knoll increase fourfold in one year as visitor numbers rise
item.description: About 50,000 people climb Bluff Knoll in WA's Stirling Range each year, and emergency services say they are being called to more rescues as hikers underestimate the challenging track.

item.title: What time is the Melbourne Cup? How to watch and the weather forecast
item.description: Rain in Melbourne is set to play a factor in Australia's most famous horse race, with Flemington Racecourse predicted to be rated a Soft 7 or Heavy 8 for Tuesday's Melbourne Cup.

item.description: The Storm say Eli Katoa had surgery after suffering "seizure activity" following multiple head knocks in the Tonga and New Zealand clash, and the league and players' association are set to investigate.

item.description: As incarceration rates continue to soar in the Northern Territory, experts say mental health reform in the justice system is crucial for improving community safety in the long term.

item.title: Melbourne hoping for chance to face undefeated North Melbourne in AFLW finals

item.description: The Bathurst childcare worker is said to have used "considerable force" on the child, resulting in his head needing medical adhesive.

item.description: A severe thunderstorm brought down trees and cut power for several hours in Alice Springs.

item.title: Alleged manslaughter victim resorted to eating from school bins, court told
item.description: A girl who died, allegedly as a result of criminal neglect by her mother, had resorted to eating food out of bins at her school, a court has heard. Warning: This story includes references to child abuse and self-harm.

item.description: Thousands of pages of evidence had to be reissued to defence team after it was lost in server crash.

item.title: Your rights when it comes to breastfeeding and expressing at work
item.description: There are many ways to combine breastfeeding and paid work, for example expressing milk, breastfeeding during breaks, or working from home. Knowing your rights can help you feel more confident when negotiating what that looks like.

item.description: Australia's last women's singles grand slam champ is encouraged by the new crop of kids coming through, but has urged fans to remain patient with their progress.

item.description: Former South Australian opposition leader David Speirs says he will make a decision about his political future in the coming weeks as he launches his own plans for the algal bloom.

item.description: Following the deaths of a 15-year-old and an eight-year-old in the space of less than two days, Gold Coast Mayor Tom Tate calls for urgent change to Queensland laws.

item.description: Former Broncos captain Gorden Tallis joins interstate rivals as a part-owner alongside former Knights playmaker Matthew Johns.

item.title: Liberals shifting towards dumping net zero, despite moderate faction fears
item.description: The centre of debate inside the Liberals appears to be shifting towards dumping net zero, as a tumultuous debate unfolds following the Nationals' decision to formally abandon the 2050 target.

item.description: Umar Al Enizi is charged with the murder of Troy Vandenberg in September 2021. The jury heard both men were "total strangers" who had been involved in an altercation.

item.title: Suspected meteor spotted in afternoon sky across Victoria's Gippsland region
item.description: Victorians living in the state's Gippsland region say they saw a streak of light whizzing through the Sunday afternoon sky and heard a sonic boom, with many wondering if they saw space junk or a meteor.

item.description: A sophisticated Chinese spy ship monitors Australian, Philippines, United States and New Zealand naval forces as they conduct another round of joint exercises in the South China Sea.

item.description: While Australia's relationship with China has improved, there is still growing unease about Beijing's military power.

item.title: Angel Seafood halts oyster relocation amid protesters' algal bloom fears
item.description: A blockade at a boat ramp to prevent oysters from entering an open fishing bay, over fears of spreading the algal bloom, leads to the destruction of nearly $70,000 worth of oysters.

item.title: O'Neil welcomes housing progress despite price surge, while Bragg says no to 'NIMBYs'
item.description: As the government comes under pressure for rising house prices in the first month of its expanded home deposit guarantee, Clare O'Neil welcomes signs of progress on supply.

item.title: Erin Patterson lodges appeal request in attempt to fight mushroom murder convictions
item.description: The triple-murderer lodges documents in Victoria's Court of Appeal requesting an appeal against her convictions.

item.title: Suspected meteor lights up Gippsland afternoon
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Sale of WA's Yeeda Pastoral Company near Broome completed, NT abattoir tipped to reopen in 2026
item.description: The sale of Yeeda Pastoral Company, including the Kimberley Meat Company, to TLP4 Australian Holdings is now complete.

item.title: Canberra man avoids jail sentence over part in violent home invasion
item.description: Xiantao Shang went to an apartment seeking a woman who owed him money. When told she was not there, he and an accomplice forced their way in and assaulted the couple inside.

item.title: Students with disability isolated, unsupported in ACT public schools
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: UK train stabbing suspect also charged over incident at London Tube station
item.description: Police are investigating possible links between a man accused of a mass stabbing on an English train and a series of other incidents.

item.title: Corrections officers placed spit hood on Wayne Hunt, stripped him naked after seizure, coroner hears
item.description: A 56-year-old man was stripped naked, handcuffed and made to wear a spit hood after suffering a seizure inside prison, a coronial inquest into his death has heard.

item.title: Man who shot poodle in Central Coast caravan park robbery sentenced to eight years in prison
item.description: A man who shot a dog in the face during a robbery on the Central Coast of New South Wales has been sentenced to eight years in prison.

item.title: Australians to get three hours of free electricity every day under solar scheme
item.description: Saying there is enough solar power for everyone in the daytime, the federal government will direct retailers to provide three hours of free power every day to consumers.

item.title: Papua New Guinea conjoined twins should not be separated due to risk of death, hospital says
item.description: Conjoined twins are extraordinarily rare, accounting for fewer than every two in 100,000 births.

item.title: 'Just started erupting': Medieval tower near Colosseum in Rome collapses
item.description: One worker has been critically injured and another was trapped for hours after the tower collapsed while undergoing renovations.

item.title: France threatens to ban Shein if it resumes selling 'childlike' sex dolls
item.description: France has threatened to ban Shein from accessing the country's market if the Chinese retailer ever resumed selling the dolls.

item.title: ICC warns atrocities by paramilitary group in Sudan may constitute war crimes
item.description: Reports from the Sudanese city of El-Fasher of mass killings, rapes and other violence "may constitute war crimes and crimes against humanity", the International Criminal Court has warned.

item.title: 'Good neighbours': China and Russia talk up trade and security ties
item.description: As Russian Prime Minister Mikhail Mishustin visits the country, Chinese Premier Li Qiang says the two countries "trust each other" and want to deepen their security and economic ties.

item.title: New environment laws could help or harm nature depending on the minister
item.description: Ambiguous language in draft national environment laws means acting on scientific facts or not will come down to ministerial discretion.

item.title: Housing supply lags behind demand in St Helens on Tasmania's east coast
item.description: For some residents of Tasmania's east coast, it is either leave the region or risk being homeless as they grapple with a scarcity of long-term rentals.

item.title: The Hobart stadium order has been tabled in parliament — here's what happens next
item.description: After years of talk, the process to decide the fate of the contentious $1.13 billion stadium at Macquarie Point is finally under way. Here's how it will all unfold.

item.title: Wet, windy and cold as thousands flock to Flemington for the Melbourne Cup
item.description: The 165th running of the Melbourne Cup is set to be a soggy one, as rain drenches the city ahead of the race that stops a nation.

item.title: Zohran Mamdani could be New York's next mayor. His path has been part Barack Obama, part Donald Trump
item.description: Donald Trump has thrust the Democrats into the political wilderness but an uprising in the gritty streets of New York may be their future.

item.title: How the arrest of an Israeli military lawyer has again shone light on shocking abuse of Palestinians
item.description: Israel's top military lawyer is behind bars after leaking a video of shocking alleged abuse of a Palestinian man in a military jail. This is why the case has shaken politics and the military to the core.

item.title: Climate change increasingly contributing to home insurance premium hikes, IAG warns
item.description: A report from IAG and a scientific research centre finds escalating risk from severe weather events in south-east Queensland, New South Wales, and south-west Western Australia.

item.title: Why Michele Bullock is relieved she is keeping rates on hold as markets continue to shift
item.description: Last week the RBA governor issued a blunt warning on the state of financial markets and as markets continue to shift from traditional valuation methods, plenty of cool heads are getting nervous.

item.title: Coalition to meet after Nationals lead charge to dump net zero
item.description: The Coalition will gather this morning at a joint party room session as the issue of whether to keep or ditch its net zero commitment roils within the party.

item.title: Mouse numbers on the rise, farmers told to be on alert
item.description: The CSIRO is urging farmers to reduce opportunities for mice breeding this harvest season as the threat of a pest population boom looms.

item.title: Feral pigs devour 99 out of every 100 lambs on this Central West NSW farm
item.description: Neville Mattick says feral pigs are eating the lambs on his farm in the NSW Central West, with fewer than one in 100 surviving this season.

item.title: The World Egg and Sperm Bank's proposed 'reward' scheme for IVF companies raises concerns
item.description: In an email seen by the ABC, a US-based egg bank told IVF clinics it was introducing its new "Client Success Reward Program in Australia".

item.title: Damaged solar panels can be dangerous. Here's what to do if wild weather has impacted yours
item.description: If solar panels at your property sustain hail damage, is there anything you can do to avoid further problems?

item.title: Inadequate funding, outdated class sizes among challenges for children with disability in ACT public schools
item.description: Liam used to dread walking through the school gates. Now, he can't wait to learn — but it took leaving a system that made him feel ignored to get there.

item.title: Sydney mum recounts 'panic' at discovering day care wrongly gave son to another person
item.description: Sophie Tilley says she arrived at her son's child care to be told an "older man in shorts" had already collected him.

item.title: Moment medieval tower partially collapses near Colosseum in Rome
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Dedicated radio station launched to help kids in custody get back on track
item.description: A dedicated radio station launches at a Western Sydney juvenile justice facility, helping troubled teens share their stories and rewrite their futures.

item.title: RBA live updates: Reserve Bank expected to keep interest rates on hold after inflation shock, ASX falls
item.description: A Cup Day rate cut is widely expected to be off the agenda when the RBA board delivers its latest decision this afternoon. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Melbourne Cup jockey Jamie Melham eyes off history on board Half Yours
item.description: Star jockey Jamie Melham and her mount Half Yours will carry the weight of a nation as one of the Melbourne Cup favourites at a wet Flemington.

item.title: Federal politics live: Dumping net zero would make Australia 'a pariah state', Liberal warns
item.description: Walking away from net zero would make Australia a "pariah state", Liberal frontbencher Andrew Bragg has warned. Follow live.

item.title: Judge rejects plea deal for funeral home owners accused of dumping bodies
item.description: A US judge rejects a plea deal granting shorter jail sentences to funeral home owners accused of stashing nearly 190 decaying bodies in a bug-infested building.

item.title: Avalanche on Nepal's Yalung Ri mountain kills at least seven, officials say
item.description: An avalanche on Mount Yalung Ri has killed five foreign climbers, whose nationalities are yet to be confirmed, and two Nepali guides, while at least five others were injured at the mountain's base camp.

item.title: Stolen Generations survivors overlooked in aged care reform, advocates say
item.description: "Discriminatory" changes to means testing in aged care could leave Stolen Generations survivors having to pay high fees for basic everyday services.

item.title: Police offer $1m reward for information about Theresa Binge's murder
item.description: Police are offering a $1 million reward for information about the murder of a woman near the New South Wales-Queensland border more than 20 years ago.

item.title: Marnus Labuschagne enjoying best form in six years ahead of Ashes
item.description: With the first men's Ashes Test starting in just over two weeks, Marnus Labuschagne reminds selectors of his ability with the bat after hitting another century for Queensland.

item.title: Earthquake kills at least 20, damages Afghanistan's ancient Blue Mosque
item.description: The centuries-old Blue Mosque site, one of Afghanistan's most revered religious landmarks, is a major gathering place during Islamic and cultural festivals.

item.title: Diane Ladd, three-time Oscar nominee, dies aged 89
item.description: Diane Ladd, a three-time Academy Award nominee whose roles ranged from the brash waitress in Alice Doesn't Live Here Anymore to the protective mother in Wild at Heart, has died at 89.

item.title: Andrew Forrest's plan to alter sacred Ashburton River under fresh legal scrutiny
item.description: Mining billionaire Andrew Forrest's controversial plan to alter the natural river system on his large outback WA cattle station is under renewed legal scrutiny.

item.title: Doctor and dedicated volunteer Felix Ho named 2026 NT Australian of the Year
item.description: From a dedicated doctor and a rubbish warrior, to a local hero who stopped a knife attack and helped fight Black Summer fires, the 2026 Northern Territory Australian of the Year awards are spotlighting local legends.

item.title: WA avocado growers eye record crop as export negotiations with China continue
item.description: WA growers say they are on track to "smash" the record season they enjoyed two years ago, but the volume of production means it is crucial to increase exports.

item.title: Clean-up underway after stormy weather hits, 400 calls for help in Sydney
item.description: A clean-up is underway after a fast-moving storm cell left a trail of destruction across parts of Sydney overnight.

item.title: Thirteen arrested as pro-Palestinian protesters clash with police at defence expo in Sydney
item.description: Dozens of demonstrators from Palestine Action Group rallied outside the Sydney International Convention Centre on Tuesday morning.

item.title: Melbourne Cup 2025 live updates: Al Riffa and Half Yours favourites as wet weather hits Flemington
item.description: International horse Al Riffa has become the new favourite for the 2025 Melbourne Cup after persistent rain resulted in Flemington Racecourse being rated as a Soft 6. Follow live.

item.title: China extends visa-free entry for 45 countries, including Australia, to end of 2026
item.description: The extension, which is until the end of 2026, covers 32 European countries as well as Australia, New Zealand, Japan, South Korea and several nations in South America and the Gulf region.

item.title: Darwin, Hobart and Canberra will all have no queer bars or clubs by the end of 2025
item.description: For the LGBTQIA+ community, queer pubs and clubs can be an oasis. But in some capital cities they are vanishing.

item.title: Severe storms lash south-east Queensland for third day running
item.description: Severe storms have again rolled through southern Queensland, smashing parts of the state still recovering from weekend weather.

item.title: Women in WA's Pilbara volunteer for marine rescue service in record numbers
item.description: Women now make up 43 per cent of marine rescue volunteers in WA's north, despite the much higher ratio of men to women in the region.

item.title: Mock crime scene workshop aims to drive more youth interest in regional careers
item.description: When former police detective turned educator Luke Taylor swapped his badge and gun for a classroom, he realised his crime-solving skills could apply to multiple career pathways.

item.title: World's oldest Olympic gold medallist, Charles Coste, dies
item.description: Charles Coste, who won Olympic gold in track cycling's team pursuit in London in 1948, left behind a sporting legacy.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Moment trapped worker rescued from partially collapsed medieval tower in Rome
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Larissa Behrendt's Boyer Lecture argues justice and imagination are an investment in democracy
item.description: I want to reflect on what I have come to see, through my own experience, as both the illuminating strengths and the shadowed weaknesses of the Australian legal system and its role in our democracy.

item.title: Eli Katoa's 'scary' NRL concussion draws condemnation from ex-player Shaun Johnson
item.description: Former NRL star Shaun Johnson has called for heads to roll after the "scary" incidents that saw Eli Katoa requiring oxygen pitchside after suffering three head knocks in Tonga's clash with New Zealand at Eden Park.

item.title: Worker dies after being rescued from Italian medieval tower collapse
item.description: A Romanian worker who was trapped for hours under rubble in Rome after the partial collapse of a 787-year-old medieval tower near the Colosseum has died, according to local media.

item.title: Lone survivor of Air India crash tells UK media 'God took all my happiness'
item.description: The only survivor of a plane crash in India tells UK media of the mental and physical anguish he has endured since the deadly disaster that killed his brother.

item.title: Man dies, five people injured in Kununurra crash in remote WA
item.description: A man has died and five people, including two children, have been injured in a remote crash in WA's north.

item.title: Mount Gambier woman appears in court charged over damage to city's Cast in Blue sculpture
item.description: A 19-year-old woman appears in court via telephone accused of damaging Mount Gambier's Cast in Blue sculpture, which has drawn criticism for its cost and appearance.
